bcIz1zCfP.value: Leh Ladakh is a region in the northernmost part of India, located in the state of Jammu and Kashmir. It is renowned for its awe-inspiring landscapes, ancient Buddhist monasteries, and unique cultural heritage. Situated at high altitudes ranging from around 2,500 to 5,000 meters above sea level, Leh Ladakh is often referred to as a "land of high passes." The region is surrounded by towering mountains, including the Himalayas and the Karakoram Range, offering breathtaking vistas of snow-capped peaks, deep valleys, and azure blue lakes. Pangong Lake, Tso Moriri, and Nubra Valley are among the most iconic natural attractions in the area. Leh, the main town in the region, is characterized by its traditional Tibetan-style architecture, bustling bazaars, and serene monasteries such as Thiksey and Hemis. The cultural richness of Leh Ladakh is reflected in its vibrant festivals, such as Hemis Festival and Ladakh Festival, which showcase traditional music, dance, and art forms. Despite its remote location and challenging terrain, Leh Ladakh has become increasingly popular among adventure enthusiasts for activities such as trekking, mountaineering, and river rafting. The region 's pristine beauty, coupled with its rich cultural heritage, makes it a truly unforgettable destination for travelers seeking an offbeat and immersive experience.

bcIz1zCfP.value: Spiti (pronounced as Piti in Bhoti language) is a high-altitude region of the Himalayas, located in the north-eastern part of the northern Indian state of Himachal Pradesh. The name Spiti means “The middle land"" i.e. the land between Tibet and India. Spiti incorporates the valley of the Spiti river, and the valleys of several rivers that feed into the Spiti river. Some of the prominent sidevalleys in Spiti are the Pin valley and the Lingti valley. Spiti is bordered on the east by Tibet, on the north by Ladakh on the west and southwest by Lahaul, on the south by Kullu, and on the southeast by Kinnaur. The valley band its surrounding regions are among the east populated regions of India.Spiti has a cold desert environment. The Bhoti-speaking local population follow Tibet an Buddhism.

bcIz1zCfP.value: Kedarnath Mandir (Kedarnath Temple) is a Hindu temple(shrine) dedicated to Lord Shiva (Mahadeva). Located on the Garhwal Himalayan range near the Mandakini river, Kedarnath is located in the state of Uttarakhand, India. Due to extreme weather conditions, the temple is open to the general public only between the months of April (Akshaya Tritiya) and November (Kartik Purnima, the autumn full moon). During the winters, the vigraha (deity) from Kedarnath temple is carried down to Ukhimath and where the deity is worshiped for the next six months. Kedarnath is seen as a homogenous form of Lord Shiva, the Lord of Kedarkhand', the historical name of the region.

bcIz1zCfP.value:
The Do Dham Yatra to Kedarnath and Badrinath in Uttarakhand,
India, is a revered pilgrimage blending spirituality and natural
beauty. Kedarnath, dedicated to Lord Shiva, stands at 3,583 meters
amidst the picturesque Kedarnath range. The journey involves a
scenic 19-kilometer trek from Gaurikund. Badrinath, dedicated to
Lord Vishnu, at 3,133 meters, offers breathtaking views of the
Himalayas and the confluence of rivers. Both temples hold
immense religious significance and are part of the Char Dham
Yatra. The pilgrimage, while spiritually enriching, demands physical
endurance due to high altitudes. Pilgrims embark seeking blessings
and solace, amidst the adventure and serenity of the Himalayas.
It's a journey of devotion and discovery, leaving an indelible mark
on the hearts of thousands who undertake it annually.

bcIz1zCfP.value: Leh Ladakh is a region in the northernmost part of India, located in the state of Jammu and Kashmir. It is renowned for its awe-inspiring landscapes, ancient Buddhist monasteries, and unique cultural heritage. Situated at high altitudes ranging from around 2,500 to 5,000 meters above sea level, Leh Ladakh is often referred to as a "land of high passes". The region is surrounded by towering mountains, including the Himalayas and the Karakoram Range, offering breathtaking vistas of snow-capped peaks, deep valleys, and azure blue lakes. Pangong Lake, Tso Moriri, and Nubra Valley are among the most iconic natural attractions in the area. Leh, the main town in the region, is characterized by its traditional Tibetan-style architecture, bustling bazaars, and serene monasteries such as Thiksey and Hemis. The cultural richness of Leh Ladakh is reflected in its vibrant festivals, such as Hemis Festival and Ladakh Festival, which showcase traditional music, dance, and art forms. Despite its remote location and challenging terrain, Leh Ladakh has become increasingly popular among adventure enthusiasts for activities such as trekking, mountaineering, and river rafting. The region's pristine beauty, coupled with its rich cultural heritage, makes it a truly unforgettable destination for travelers seeking an offbeat and immersive experience

Chandrataal, also known as the "Moon Lake," is a stunning highaltitude lake in the Spiti Valley of Himachal Pradesh, India. It is
renowned for its crescent shape and crystal-clear waters,
surrounded by the majestic Himalayas, making it a favorite among
trekkers and nature enthusiasts.
Deepak Taal, a serene lake located near the Baralacha La Pass,
offers a peaceful ambiance with its calm waters reflecting the
surrounding snow-capped peaks. It serves as a perfect pit stop for
travelers exploring the region.
Suraj Taal, also known as the "Lake of the Sun God," is one of the
highest lakes in India, nestled in the Lahaul Valley. Its pristine beauty
and turquoise waters attract adventurers and photographers alike.

Discover the perfect blend of history, culture, nature, and modern architecture on this 5 Nights & 6 Days journey through Azerbaijan. From the vibrant streets of Baku to the scenic mountains of Gabala and the unique landscapes of Qobustan, this trip offers a complete Caucasus experience.

Begin in Baku, the capital city where ancient heritage meets futuristic design. Explore the charming Old City (Icharishaher), including the Maiden Tower and Palace of Shirvanshah, stroll along Baku Boulevard, visit Highland Park, Flame Towers, and enjoy a funicular ride with panoramic city views.

Travel to the beautiful region of Gabala, surrounded by the Caucasus Mountains. Visit Nohur Lake, the stunning Yeddi Gozel Waterfall (Seven Beauties), and take a ropeway ride at Tufandag Mountain Resort for breathtaking mountain views.

Experience Azerbaijan’s unique natural wonders with a visit to Qobustan National Park, famous for its ancient rock petroglyphs and fascinating mud volcanoes. Discover the spiritual side of the country at the Ateshgah Fire Temple and witness the natural flames of Yanardag (Fire Mountain).

Discover the perfect blend of history, culture, nature, and modern architecture on this 5 Nights & 6 Days journey through Azerbaijan. From the vibrant streets of Baku to the scenic mountains of Gabala and the unique landscapes of Qobustan, this trip offers a complete Caucasus experience.

Begin in Baku, the capital city where ancient heritage meets futuristic design. Explore the charming Old City (Icharishaher), including the Maiden Tower and Palace of Shirvanshah, stroll along Baku Boulevard, visit Highland Park, Flame Towers, and enjoy a funicular ride with panoramic city views.

Travel to the beautiful region of Gabala, surrounded by the Caucasus Mountains. Visit Nohur Lake, the stunning Yeddi Gozel Waterfall (Seven Beauties), and take a ropeway ride at Tufandag Mountain Resort for breathtaking mountain views.

Experience Azerbaijan’s unique natural wonders with a visit to Qobustan National Park, famous for its ancient rock petroglyphs and fascinating mud volcanoes. Discover the spiritual side of the country at the Ateshgah Fire Temple and witness the natural flames of Yanardag (Fire Mountain).

Experience the best of Vietnam on this 7 Nights & 8 Days journey covering Ho Chi Minh City, Da Nang, Hoi An, Ba Na Hills, Hanoi, Ninh Binh, and Halong Bay. This itinerary perfectly blends history, adventure, nightlife, scenic landscapes, and cultural exploration.

Begin in Ho Chi Minh City, exploring colonial landmarks, enjoying a guided walking tour, and experiencing the electric nightlife of Bui Vien Walking Street. Discover Vietnam’s wartime history with a guided visit to the legendary Cu Chi Tunnels, including the option to fire real AK47 and M4 rifles (at own expense).

Fly to Da Nang and explore the charming lantern-lit streets of Hoi An, enjoy a unique Basket Boat Ride in the Coconut Forest, and visit the spectacular Ba Na Hills, home to the iconic Golden Hand Bridge, French Village, Fantasy Park, and panoramic cable car rides.

Continue to Hanoi, where you’ll walk through the bustling Old Quarter, sip egg coffee at the famous Train Street, and experience the city’s lively beer culture. Explore the natural beauty of Ninh Binh, climbing Mua Caves for panoramic views and cruising through limestone caves in Trang An.

The journey concludes with a scenic Halong Bay Cruise, featuring kayaking, cave walks, island hikes, swimming, and sunset views over emerald waters.

Experience the perfect mix of luxury, adventure, and modern marvels on this 5 Nights & 6 Days Dubai getaway. From glittering skyscrapers and desert adventures to world-famous attractions and theme parks, this itinerary captures the very best of the UAE.

Your journey begins in Dubai, where you’ll cruise through the stunning Marina on a traditional Dhow Cruise Dinner, surrounded by dazzling skyline views. Explore the city’s iconic landmarks on a guided tour, including Jumeirah Mosque, Palm Jumeirah, Burj Al Arab photo stop, Atlantis, Gold & Spice Souks, and more.

Visit the world’s tallest building, Burj Khalifa (124th Floor), and witness the magical Dubai Fountain Show at Dubai Mall. Step into the future at the Museum of the Future, and gear up for an unforgettable Desert Safari experience featuring dune bashing, camel rides, live entertainment, and a BBQ dinner under the stars.

Enjoy a leisure day to explore Dubai your way before heading to Abu Dhabi, where thrill meets speed at Ferrari World, home to the world’s fastest roller coaster. Conclude your journey with a visit to the magnificent Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque, one of the most beautiful architectural masterpieces in the world.

  • Later, visit the mighty Burj Khalifa and soar up to the 124th floor during nonprime hours for insane panoramic views.

Sangla Holi Special Trips offer a vibrant and culturally
immersive experience in the heart of Himachal Pradesh.
Celebrated against the stunning backdrop of the Sangla Valley,
these trips combine the joy of Holi festivities with the natural
beauty of the region. Travelers can partake in traditional Holi
rituals, engaging in lively color play with locals amidst the
majestic mountains. The Sangla Valley, known for its apple
orchards, traditional wooden architecture, and the Baspa River
flowing through, adds a unique charm to the celebration.
Explore local markets, savor traditional cuisine, and witness
cultural performances that showcase the rich heritage of the
region. Immerse yourself in the warmth of the local community,
creating memories of a Holi celebration unlike any other,
surrounded by the enchanting landscapes of Sangla. These
special trips offer a perfect blend of cultural immersion and
scenic beauty, making it an unforgettable Holi experience

Experience the perfect blend of beaches, hills, heritage, and wildlife on this 7 Nights & 8 Days Sri Lanka journey with Nomads Travel Club.

This thoughtfully curated itinerary takes you through some of Sri Lanka’s most stunning destinations from the serene beaches of Mirissa to the scenic hill town of Ella, the cultural capital Kandy, the historic marvel of Sigiriya, and the vibrant city of Colombo.

Enjoy breathtaking coastal views, explore lush tea plantations, visit ancient UNESCO World Heritage Sites, witness majestic waterfalls, and experience close encounters with elephants at Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage. The trip also includes exciting experiences like a Glass Bottom Boat Ride, Sigiriya Rock Fortress climb, Nine Arch Bridge visit, and the Flying Ravana Zip-line.

d2NsTsvCt.value:
• Arrive at Colombo International Airport and clear immigration.

  • Meet our representative for your transfer to Mirissa, a peaceful beach town known for its beaches, laid-back vibe, and seasonal whale watching.

  • Enjoy the scenic drive from city to coast.

  • Check in to your hotel and relax.

  • Spend the rest of the day at leisure by the beach.

  • Overnight in Mirissa.

Vd9JMFXup.value: Day trip to Unawatuna & Galle - Glass boat ride + Galle city tour

fRipqFemz.value:
• Wake up to a beautiful morning with cool sea breeze in Mirissa.

  • After breakfast, get ready for an exciting day ahead.

  • Today we will head to Unawatuna which is famous for its golden beaches, calm waters and rich coral reefs ideal for swimming and snorkelling. Here, we will take a glass-bottomed boat ride to the reef and watch the rich marine life in their natural habitat.

  • We will then head further to Galle, a city rich in history that beautifully blends European architecture with South Asian traditions.

  • Here, we will explore the Galle Dutch Fort - a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

  • Walk along the fort’s ramparts and explore its colonial-era streets, quiet cafés, boutique shops and beautiful churches.

  • During the city tour, we will also visit the Maritime Museum and Galle Lighthouse.

  • In the evening, return to Mirissa and spend the rest of the evening relaxing by the sea.

  • Overnight stay in Mirissa.

HQ9UFTOGo.value: Transfer to Ella | Explore Sri Lanka’s Tea Plantations and Ravana waterfalls

Pb90Dem6p.value:
• Wake up to a beautiful morning in Mirissa. After breakfast, check out and travel to

  • Ella, a charming hill town surrounded by tea plantations.

  • En route, enjoy scenic winding roads and lush green hills, with a stop at Ravana Falls, one of Sri Lanka’s widest waterfalls at 100 ft.

  • Continue to Ella, check in to your hotel, and relax after the journey.

  • Overnight stay in Ella.

jK9CbYCEF.value: Full-Day Ella City Tour : Explore Nine Arch Bridge, Ravana Zipline & Pool Club

iIxDBOr6F.value:
• Wake up to a misty morning in Ella. After breakfast, start exploring this picturesque town.

  • Visit the iconic Nine Arches Bridge, a colonial-era stone railway bridge set amidst lush tea plantations—a perfect spot for photos.

  • Next, get your adrenaline fix at the Flying Ravana Mega Zipline near Little Adam’s Peak, soaring over the mountains for breathtaking views of Ella.

  • Later, unwind at Ravana Pool Club, Sri Lanka’s first pool club, enjoying a drink with stunning vistas of Little Adam’s Peak and Ella Rock.

  • Relax and soak in the serene beauty.

  • Overnight stay in Ella.

NKTGgIGtX.value: Transfers From Ella To Kandy Via Nuwara Eliya. Visit Tea Plantation & Ramboda Falls

F7WclM2Z5.value:
• Wake up in Ella and enjoy breakfast at your hotel before checking out.

  • Travel to Nuwara Eliya, also known as “Little England”, famous for its British colonial architecture and cool climate. The drive takes around 1.5–2 hours through scenic mountains and lush tea plantations.

  • En route, stop at the Seetha Amman Temple, an important shrine from the

Get ready for the wildest New Year celebration in the world! This 6 Nights & 7 Days Thailand Songkran Special takes you through Phuket, Phi Phi Island, and Krabi, combining insane water festival energy with stunning island adventures.

The journey kicks off in Phuket, where Bangla Road transforms into a high-energy water battlefield during Songkran. Expect massive water fights, live DJs, beach vibes, nightlife chaos, and unforgettable party scenes. From there, explore the iconic Phi Phi Islands, swim in emerald lagoons, relax on white-sand beaches, and snorkel vibrant coral reefs. Then head to Krabi, where you’ll enjoy the famous 4 Islands Speedboat Tour, crystal-clear waters, snorkeling adventures, and a lively Ao Nang beach party vibe.

Explore the breathtaking landscapes of Kazakhstan on this 5 Nights & 6 Days Almaty adventure that blends vibrant city culture with dramatic natural wonders. From scenic lakes and majestic canyons to snow-capped mountains and charming villages, this trip offers the perfect balance of exploration and relaxation.

Begin your journey in Almaty, Kazakhstan’s cultural capital, with a guided city tour covering Panfilov’s 28 Guardsmen Park, the iconic Zenkov Cathedral, Arbat Street, and Astana Square. Enjoy stunning sunset and night views from Kok Tobe Hill via a scenic cable car ride.

Venture into the countryside to witness the surreal beauty of Charyn Canyon, often called the “Grand Canyon of Asia,” followed by a peaceful stay in Saty Village near the stunning Kolsai Lake, surrounded by towering mountains. On your return, visit the magical Kaindy Lake, famous for its submerged forest and turquoise waters.

Blgy5qaqO.value: What exactly is the Full Moon Party?

RnPd2Vj5P.value: The Full Moon Party is a massive beach party held every month on Koh Phangan, famous for fire shows, international DJs, neon body paint, and dancing till sunrise right on the beach.

H0Dxk91QF.value: Is the Full Moon Party safe?

PaRHt6QzF.value: Yes, if you’re smart. Stick with the group, avoid swimming at night, watch your drinks, and don’t overdo alcohol. We also plan accommodation and transport to keep things hassle-free and safe.

RdBz0XgnQ.value: What should I wear to the Full Moon Party?

hgqCh5jbZ.value: Light, comfortable clothes you don’t mind getting dirty. Neon outfits, shorts, flip-flops or shoes you can lose are ideal. Avoid valuables—phones should be secured, not flaunted.

SDSjdscmT.value: Is this trip only about partying?

tZHYXeW2o.value: No. The Full Moon Party is the highlight, but the trip also includes island hopping, beaches, viewpoints, chill days, and recovery time. It’s a balance of chaos and calm.

ebZ7c4us7.value: Do I need prior party or travel experience to join?

B7955KObH.value: Not at all. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned traveler, everything is planned so you can just show up and enjoy. You’ll be with like-minded people, not random tourists.

r1OxfQKmH.value: What’s included and what’s not included?

HkudDOfBI.value: Accommodation, local transfers, group experiences, and coordination are included. Flights, visa fees, personal expenses, and party drinks are not included (because trust us—you’ll want freedom there).

Experience Japan at its most magical during cherry blossom season on this 8 Nights & 9 Days journey from Tokyo to Osaka. This specially curated Cherry Blossom edition blends Japan’s timeless traditions, futuristic cities, scenic landscapes, and cultural heritage — all framed by beautiful sakura blooms.

Your adventure begins in Tokyo, where ancient temples like Sensō-ji stand alongside futuristic marvels such as TeamLab Planets and Tokyo Skytree. Walk through vibrant streets like Shibuya, explore historic neighborhoods, and witness cherry blossoms at iconic viewing spots.

Travel onward to Mt. Fuji and Hakone, where breathtaking mountain views, the Mt. Fuji 5th Station, Lake Ashi pirate cruise, and Hakone Ropeway showcase Japan’s natural beauty. Experience the thrill of Japan’s famous bullet train as you journey to Kyoto.

In Kyoto, immerse yourself in Japan’s cultural and spiritual heart — from the Arashiyama Bamboo Grove and Golden Pavilion (Kinkakuji) to the thousand red torii gates of Fushimi Inari Shrine. Visit Nara’s Deer Park and historic temples before continuing to vibrant Osaka, known for its iconic castle, lively streets, and modern cityscape.

  • Evening drop-off at Shibuya Crossing, the world’s busiest scramble intersection, with nearly 3,000 pedestrians crossing daily.

  • Enjoy cherry blossoms and sakura decorations throughout the day.

  • Return to your hotel.

  • Overnight stay in Tokyo.

HQ9UFTOGo.value: Day at Leisure in Tokyo | Explore at Your Own Pace and See the Beautiful Blossoms

Pb90Dem6p.value:
• Enjoy breakfast at your hotel and spend the day at leisure.

  • Relax at the hotel or explore Tokyo on your own.

  • Visit cherry-blossom spots like Ueno Park or Chidorigafuchi Moat"

  • Explore the Meiji Shinto Shrine and its surrounding woods.

  • Visit the Imperial Palace and walk around its park-like grounds for photos.

  • Explore the National Museum of Tokyo, showcasing Japanese art.

  • Stroll through Togoshi Ginza, Tokyo’s longest shopping street.

  • Optional: Tokyo Disneyland

  • Take transfers to Tokyo Disneyland with 7 themed zones.

  • Enjoy thrilling rides, haunted tours, theatre shows, and interactive performances."

  • Click photos with Disney characters and shop for merchandise.

  • Return to your hotel after the park visit.

  • Spend the evening at Meguro River, known for illuminated cherry blossoms

  • End the day after exploring Tokyo or Disneyland.

  • Overnight stay in Tokyo.

jK9CbYCEF.value: Tokyo to Mt. Fuji and Hakone | Discover Japan’s Scenic Beauty and Mountain Charm

iIxDBOr6F.value:
• Enjoy breakfast at the hotel, check out, and begin your scenic road journey toward Mt. Fuji

  • Stop at Mt. Fuji 5th Station (2,300m), the highest point accessible by vehicle, and admire stunning views of Mt. Fuji and cherry-blossom-covered valleys.

  • Visit the iconic Chureito Pagoda, known for its perfect Mt. Fuji backdrop framed by colourful sakura trees; explore the serene surroundings and click photos.

  • Continue to Hakone, a resort town known for hot springs and natural beauty.

  • Check into your Hakone hotel and relax after the day’s mountain exploration.

  • Optionally, enjoy a traditional onsen bath in the evening.

  • Overnight stay in Hakone.

NKTGgIGtX.value: Hakone to Kyoto | Scenic Cruise, Ropeway Ride, and Journey to the Cultural Heart of Japan

F7WclM2Z5.value:
• Wake up to a fresh morning in Hakone and enjoy breakfast at your hotel.

  • Begin your half-day Hakone tour with a visit to Lake Ashi, a scenic crater lake formed by an ancient volcanic eruption

  • Enjoy a relaxing pirate-style cruise on the lake with beautiful views of Mt. Fuji on clear days.

  • Take a thrilling ride on the Hakone Ropeway, offering panoramic views of Owakudani Valley, known for its sulfer vents and famous black eggs boiled in hot springs.

  • After sightseeing, transfer to Odawara Station to board your train to Kyoto.

  • Enjoy the scenic bullet train ride through Japan’s countryside with views of rural landscapes and rolling green hills.

  • Arrive in Kyoto, check into your hotel, and relax for the evening.

  • Overnight stay in Kyoto."

JvBqIY3SV.value: Full-Day Kyoto City Tour | Experience Japan’s Cultural and Spiritual Heritage

DfxWgxvqj.value:
• Wake up to a beautiful morning in Kyoto and enjoy breakfast at your hotel.

  • Begin exploring Kyoto’s rich heritage.

  • Visit Arashiyama Bamboo Grove, a stunning forest of tall bamboo that offers a peaceful, zen-like walk

  • Continue to Kinkakuji (Golden Pavilion), a Buddhist Zen temple with its top two floors covered in gold leaf; stroll through its gardens and large pond.

  • Visit Fushimi Inari Shrine, famous for its thousand red torii gates on Mount Inari, beautifully contrasted with blooming cherry trees.

  • After lunch, proceed to Nara (approx. 1 hour).

  • Visit Nara Deer Park, home to around 1,200 freely roaming deer where you can interact and take photos.

  • Continue to Tōdai-ji Temple, home to Japan’s largest bronze Buddha statue, built by Toyotomi Hideyoshi’s bereaved wife in his honour.

  • Stroll around the historic temple complex, admire the architecture, and take photos

  • Return to your Kyoto hotel in the evening.

  • Overnight stay in Kyoto.

K9KsOdQpr.value: Kyoto to Osaka | Osaka City Tour - Explore Osaka’s Historic Sites

CxbLu8xrT.value:
• Wake up to a pleasant morning in Kyoto, enjoy breakfast, and check out.

  • Board your road transfers from Kyoto to Osaka.

  • Arrive in Osaka, check into your hotel, and rest for a while.

  • Head out to explore Osaka’s major attractions.

  • Visit the Umeda Sky Building, a two-tower skyscraper known for its panoramic city views.

  • Continue to Osaka Castle, one of Japan’s most iconic historic castles surrounded by a beautiful park; explore the grounds and click photos.

  • Visit Katsuo-ji Temple, famous for thousands of Daruma dolls and known as a “temple of victory” for over 1300 years, believed to bring luck in all aspects of life.

  • Explore Shinsaibashi Shopping Street, a lively pedestrian shopping zone with food stalls and boutiques."

  • Walk through Dotonbori Street to experience Osaka’s vibrant nightlife, neon lights, and street food.

  • Return to your hotel and complete check-in formalities (if not already done).

  • Spend the rest of the evening at leisure.

  • Overnight stay in Osaka.

cpBMgOg4p.value: Leisure Day in Osaka | Explore at your own leisure

RjrGIirCO.value:
• Wake up to a pleasant morning in Osaka.

  • Have your breakfast at the hotel and spend the rest of the day as you like.

  • You can visit Universal Studios Japan for thrilling rides and movie-themed attractions or go shopping in Shinsaibashi, Osaka’s top shopping street filled with fashion brands and food joints.

  • For stunning city views, head to Umeda Sky Building, a unique skyscraper with a floating garden observatory.

  • If you love local culture, explore Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan, one of the world’s largest aquariums, or take a cruise along the Tombori River

  • You can also spend your evening tasting Osaka’s famous street foods like okonomiyaki (savoury pancakes) and takoyaki (octopus balls).

  • Upon completing the sightseeing for the day, return to your hotel.

  • Overnight stay in Osaka.

u8VRoVI8x.value: Departure Day | Take Back Happy Memories Home

G6Ggx4hTT.value:
• Wake up in the morning and have your breakfast at the hotel.

  • Get ready to check out and board your transfers to the Osaka airport

  • Our amazing Japan group trip - Cherry Blossom Edition concludes once you are dropped off at the airport for your onward journey back home.

  • Depart home with a camera full of pictures from your community trip to Japan.

Blgy5qaqO.value: What exactly is the Full Moon Party?

RnPd2Vj5P.value: The Full Moon Party is a massive beach party held every month on Koh Phangan, famous for fire shows, international DJs, neon body paint, and dancing till sunrise right on the beach.

bcIz1zCfP.value:
Experience the ultimate tropical escape with this 6 Nights & 7 Days Thailand adventure covering Phuket, Koh Samui, and Krabi — a perfect mix of island hopping, nightlife, scenic cruises, and beachside relaxation.

Your journey begins in Phuket, where Patong’s vibrant nightlife and Bangla Walking Street set the tone for an energetic start. Explore the iconic Phi Phi Islands, swim in emerald lagoons, visit the world-famous Maya Bay, and snorkel in crystal-clear waters.

Next, travel to Koh Samui and gear up for the legendary Full Moon Party at Koh Phangan — neon lights, beach raves, international DJs, and unforgettable party vibes under the moonlit sky. Balance the madness with island exploration, beach cafés, hidden coastal roads, and chilled beach club evenings.

ehDqi1QjF.value:
✅ Inclusions

06 Nights of Accommodation in 3/4 Star comfort: 2N Phuket, 2N Krabi, 2N Koh Samui.

  • Meals – 06 Breakfasts, 01 Lunch, & 01 Beachy BBQ Snacks.

  • Sightseeings–All Tours & Transfers as per the itinerary.

  • Airport Pick & Drop – No Stress Arrivals & Departures.

  • Island Hops Sorted – All Internal Ferry Transfers Included.

  • Full Moon Party Transfers – Straight to the beach rave.

  • Phi Phi Island Bliss – Emerald Lagoons, Maya Bay, and Snorkel life.

  • 07 Island Sunset Cruise – with BBQ snacks & golden hour magic.

  • Snorkeling Included – coral reefs + tropical fish sightings.

❌ Exclusions

  • Taxes – 5% GST + 5% TCS (the not-so-fun part).

  • Island Entry Fees – 400 THB per person, per island tour (2 tours = 800 THB total).

  • Full Moon Party Ticket – 200 THB per person (worth every baht though).

  • Early Check-In / Late Check-Out – depends on hotel policy & extra charges.

  • Dinners – explore local food spots instead (totally worth it).

  • Extra Lunches – only the ones in the itinerary are covered.

  • Travel Insurance – BYO for peace of mind.

  • Visa Fees – pay on arrival.

RnPd2Vj5P.value: It is one of the best times to visit Thailand, with warm, sunny weather and minimal rainfall. It’s ideal for beach days and exploring. Pack light, breathable clothing, swimwear, flip-flops or sandals, sunglasses, sunscreen, and maybe a light jacket for breezy evenings.

PaRHt6QzF.value:
• Passport – 6 months validity (because future-you is suspicious).

  • Visa – On arrival (no VIP treatment, though).

  • Return Ticket – Proof you’re not moving in.

  • PAN Card – Even on vacation, taxes haunt you!"

RdBz0XgnQ.value: Do I need a visa for Thailand? What’s the process?

hgqCh5jbZ.value:
Yes, Indian passport holders need a visa. You have two options:

  • Visa on Arrival (VoA): Available at the airport.

  • E-Visa: Apply online in advance through the official Indonesian immigration website.

SDSjdscmT.value: Is this trip only about partying?

tZHYXeW2o.value: No. The Full Moon Party is the highlight, but the trip also includes island hopping, beaches, viewpoints, chill days, and recovery time. It’s a balance of chaos and calm.

ebZ7c4us7.value: Do I need prior party or travel experience to join?

B7955KObH.value: Not at all. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned traveler, everything is planned so you can just show up and enjoy. You’ll be with like-minded people, not random tourists.

r1OxfQKmH.value: What’s included and what’s not included?

HkudDOfBI.value: Accommodation, local transfers, group experiences, and coordination are included. Flights, visa fees, personal expenses, and party drinks are not included (because trust us—you’ll want freedom there).
